programme.title: The Whole Gritty City
programme.desc: The documentary follows kids in three bands as the directors get them ready to perform in the Mardi Gras parades, and teach them to succeed and to survive. Through moments of setback, loss, discovery, and triumph, these children and their adult leaders reveal the power and resilience of a culture.

programme.title: Malcolm X: AN OVERWHELMING INFLUENCE ON THE BLACK POWER MOVEMENT
programme.desc: This documentary will give viewers new insight into how Malcolm X changed America through revolutionary ideas, actions, and strategies: ideas that are still relevant and playing out in today's world. Concurrently, viewers get to know Malcolm X, the man, through personal accounts with friends, co-workers and family members along with engaging photos and footage.

programme.title: BEYOND THE PASSGE
programme.desc: Six years after a mysterious event destroyed civilization, a young girl sets out on a lone journey in hopes of saving her ailing grandfather. Little does she know, she's not alone in this dangerous new world.

programme.title: Jerusa's Day â€śo Dia De Jerusaâ€ť
programme.desc: The Day of Jerusa' narrates the encounter between Jerusa a resident of an old townhouse of Bixiga with the young Silvia which circulates through the traditional SĂŁo Paulo neighborhood doing opinion research on soap in powder.

programme.title: The Third Space EP1
programme.desc: The coffee shop is the perfect setting to have rich and in depth conversations with some of the most influential change-makers in the Bay Area and beyond. TTS has an entirely Black and people of color crew in front of and behind the camera.

programme.title: The Third Space EP2
programme.desc: The coffee shop is the perfect setting to have rich and in depth conversations with some of the most influential change-makers in the Bay Area and beyond. TTS has an entirely Black and people of color crew in front of and behind the camera.

programme.title: The Third Space EP3
programme.desc: The coffee shop is the perfect setting to have rich and in depth conversations with some of the most influential change-makers in the Bay Area and beyond. TTS has an entirely Black and people of color crew in front of and behind the camera.

programme.title: THIRD SPACE EP5
programme.desc: The coffee shop is the perfect setting to have rich and in depth conversations with some of the most influential change-makers in the Bay Area and beyond. TTS has an entirely Black and people of color crew in front of and behind the camera.

programme.title: BEALE STREET BLUES
programme.desc: A documentary about the African American bllues artists struggling to keep playing on Beale Street in Memphis, TN.

programme.title: Pahokee - The Send Off
programme.desc: Three award-winning short films that exquisitely capture the Pahokee community, a small black Florida town.

programme.title: CLOSE TO THE LINE
programme.desc: The true story of a spiritual journey. Singer/songwriter Chris Van Loan Sr.'s life is changed forever because of the events that occur in one evening amongst some of Austin's most eclectic musicians and poets. Featuring cameo appearances by Kevin Gant and Thom the World Poet.

programme.title: Wanted: Strong Woman
programme.desc: When an apprehensive woman channels her fears and insecurities into a new-found passion, it leads her to a path of self-discovery.

programme.title: AMICAR CABRAL
programme.desc: Regarded as a true icon of African history, this documentary provides considerable background to this revolutionary giant and reveals Cabral in several dimensions: as a man, a father, politician, humanist and poet.

programme.title: Jerusa's Day â€śo Dia De Jerusaâ€ť
programme.desc: The Day of Jerusa' narrates the encounter between Jerusa a resident of an old townhouse of Bixiga with the young Silvia which circulates through the traditional SĂŁo Paulo neighborhood doing opinion research on soap in powder.

programme.title: THE BEAST
programme.desc: An ordinary day at a Zulu cultural village. Shaka, their star performer, expresses his frustrations to his co-workers as he sits on display for tourists. On this day he reaches the end of his tether and his protest takes on Shakespearian proportion.

programme.title: THE FADE
programme.desc: An observational documentary that explores the lives of four barbers across the world. Following their weekly routines and adventures in Ghana, Jamaica, US and London, the film creates an emotive account of business and enterprise in the 21st Century through a unique brand of masculinity and brotherhood

programme.title: THE PIROGUE
programme.desc: In Moussa Toure’s powerful epic fiction film, a group of 30 men sail to Europe in a pirogue, facing the sea - and the possibility of never reaching their destination - in exchange for the myth of a better life in Europe.

programme.title: BROTHERS HYPNOTIC
programme.desc: For the eight young men in the Hypnotic Brass Ensemble, 'brotherhood' is literal: they're all sons of anti-establishment jazz legend, Phil Cohran.

programme.title: Jazree's Court
programme.desc: Jazree's father was sent to jail for 7 years due to possession of an unloaded firearm. Jazree, who was close to her father, talks about the implication of growing up with him behind bars. Putting a person in jail doesn't just affect that individualâ€“it affects their entire family and community.

programme.title: JERMAINE
programme.desc: Jermaine Johnson is a 36-year old father of three and husband to his high-school sweetheart, Lawanna.

programme.title: COMPANY TOWN
programme.desc: One man goes up against one of the nation's largest paper mill and chemical plants, owned by billionaire brothers Charles Koch and David Koch of Koch Industries, in a bid to save his town from sickness-causing pollution.

programme.title: FOR THE CAUSE
programme.desc: Mirai Scott, a civil rights attorney in Chicago, defends her estranged father, a former Black Panther, against a 30-year-old attempted murder charge. Long-held hostilities and accusations explode as Mirai aggressively pursues her fatherâ€™s defense.

programme.title: CHASING REFUGE
programme.desc: A selfish young man must reconcile his feelings of guilt and remorse when his estranged half-brother commits suicide.

programme.title: Negroes With Guns: Rob Williams & Black Power
programme.desc: It tells the dramatic story of Rob Williams, the often-forgotten civil rights leader who urged Black Americans to arm themselves against violent racists.
